page.title: 11WIVELSCOMBE HOUSE:TREMATON
page.content: Wivelscombe has been in the hands of the present owners since 1967. The estate includes 170 acres of land with 16 tennants. Life is difficult for Wivelscombe residents unless they have a car. The owners obtain their goods from Plymouth stores. The telephone connection is not considered adequate and the only other transport is provided by an infrequent train service, with a journey of about half an hour to the station. The house is surrounded by a well kept garden, pride of the present owners, and features an interesting Pinnacle. This was rescued from Westminster Abbey by a friend during renovation work designed to replace the decayed and polluted Portland Stone monuments. Apart from the garden, one other hobby of the owners is photography.
